I have recently picked up this game for $1.00 and can already tell that it's one of the best of our time.

This game has a good story, and great humor. However, where this game REALLY shines is in the co-op, and the workshop support. I've put in more hours in co-op chambers off the workshop with a buddy of mine than I can remember. Countless hours of fun, and plenty more in store for me!

Fun and a great addition after the hundred hours in the first game(not an exxageration you can check) It really sucked me in but not as much as the first on did It is still very enjoyable and I can switch between playing both of them and not feel sucked out like other games and sequels

i love portal/2
It's kind of an inspiration game.

it is worth the 10 dollars you pay for it the game is way more fun when you dont spoil 100% of the game it was super fun when i played it without using youtube too figure out the test but applying alot of stress to my brain which is pretty much the point personally i like the story more than online but online is best when you play with friends when your playing with randos its not that fine considering 90% of them quit 5 minutes into gameplay of a room but its worth the money just be sure to not spoil it G. Day
I absolutely adore the quality of this entire game and the juicy story behind it. All of the secrets you can find, I love it all. I can play it over and over again
everything about this games is amazing 10/10
Just get this game already. I mean, play the first one before this, but just play them. These are not games you want to miss!
This is one of the highest rated steam games for a reason
Nice puzzles and story. 10/10 would play again.

I've played for 57 hours recorded, but probably 3X that. Been through the whole thing at least 4 times. That's not trying to blaze though it, that's not even playing immediate attention to what I need to do next at any time. This is the result of deeply enjoying a very fun and detailed environment. And yes, some levels did take me a long time, with some inevitable facepalm when I finally noticed what was right before me. But what a delight in suddenly seeing the way through that you know is there, if you can just look at it differently.   Plus the background story is just so entertaining. Being a Boomer, ya gotta know this hits me where I live. If you're like, "Huh?" Imagine that Tony Stark's dad is the one that set all this up. That it is a subdivision of Stark Enterprises of the 50s and 60s. Then you'll see it.
The best coop game i've ever played

IL est bon comme ta maman

I don't think I need to explain why everyone should play this game... 

10/10.

Fantastic game, couldn't recommend more, but some chapters do drag on a bit, but if you're getting bored, there's probably a quip or great line around the corner to make you laugh. As usual, it has the trademark Valve humor, and the voice acting is fantastic. Overall I'd say 9.5/10 due to great story, visuals, humor, voice acting, creative puzzles and infinite content due to the test chamber builder and community content, but it does have some (albeit minor) flaws.

The game also has pretty good graphics for a game released a few years ago. 
What makes the game interesting are the characters, humor and the story.
